channel.title: Best decompiler?
channel.description:
Dont say JAD, cavaj, or DJ. They didnt work.
If your asking what im doing its decompiling a client.java.

item.title: Best decompiler?
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

Cavaj and DJ Java Decompiler use JAD, lollllllllllllllllllllllllllllllll.
Oh and so does “JCavaj”, some spyware infested fake Cavaj sold on the fkn internetzz.

Try JODE.
Doesn’t try as hard as JAD, but it’s nice I guess.

Read full topic

item.title: Best decompiler?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“I Am Olan14, post:12, topic:133536”][quote author=Frell link=topic=184788.msg1675463#msg1675463 date=1187153630]

In a batch file, do this(using JAD):

@ECHO OFF
jad *.class
rename *.jad *.class
pause

If not, tell us the error.

I mean less errors when you re-compile after decompiling.

Also:

Parsing client.class...Overwrite client.java [y/n/a/s] ? y Generating client.java Overlapped try statements detected. Not all exception handlers will be resolved in the method writeObjects Couldn't fully decompile method writeObjects Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method writeObjects Overlapped try statements detected. Not all exception handlers will be resolved in the method writeItems Couldn't fully decompile method writeItems Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method writeItems Overlapped try statements detected. Not all exception handlers will be resolved in the method writeMonsters Couldn't fully decompile method writeMonsters Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method writeMonsters Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method method35 Couldn't fully decompile method method41 Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method method41 Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method main Overlapped try statements detected. Not all exception handlers will be resolved in the method method62 Couldn't fully decompile method method73 Couldn't fully decompile method method75 Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method login Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method method6 Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method method108 Couldn't fully decompile method method113 Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method method113 Couldn't fully decompile method method122 Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method method122 Couldn't fully decompile method method124 Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method method124 Couldn't fully decompile method method140 Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method method145 The system cannot find the file specified. Press any key to continue . . .

Why cant it?
[/quote]
It looks like he’s decompiling a refactored 317 client…
MoparScape perhaps lol.[/quote]
Yup. But its soo hard.

Read full topic

item.title: Best decompiler?
item.dc:creator: @Fasga Fasga
item.description:
@Fasga wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:5, topic:133536”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=184788.msg1674364#msg1674364 date=1187126593]

Dont say JAD, cavaj, or DJ.

All of those use JAD.

and instead of what The-Unnamed said, use this one command in a batch file:

jad -sjava *.class

Another good decompiler is JODE, it is slightly harder to use though.
[/quote]

jode does a weird output though. defiantly not as clean as jad[/quote]
However, it outputs compilable code much more often than JAD.

Read full topic

[/quote]

All of those use JAD.

and instead of what The-Unnamed said, use this one command in a batch file:

jad -sjava *.class

Another good decompiler is JODE, it is slightly harder to use though.[/quote]

jode does a weird output though. defiantly not as clean as jad
